questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks is implementing Territory Management for its retail sales unit. The sales director is requesting a detailed roll-up forecast for territories.

Which two recommendations should the consultant make? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Include the Forecast Manager field on the Account page layout.
choices.D: Assign a role for each manager in the user role hierarchy.
choices.C: Ensure the Forecast Manager user is forecast-enabled.
choices.A: Assign a Forecast-Manager to each region.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
CD is it

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) has account and contact data it wants to migrate to Salesforce. The data comes from several sources and the data quality is unknown. The consultant wants to assess the entire data set for quality and duplicates prior to loading it to production without impacting UC’s current operations. The consultant recommends using a Developer Pro sandbox as an initial step.

Which two Salesforce tools could be used to support this approach? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Based on the information given, the correct option will be B. Create all new regional folders and move the reports to the respective region folder with viewer access.

From the information given, it was stated that the VP of sales needs one place to find the reports and still wants to retain visibility of the reports in each folder.

Therefore, it's important to create all new regional folders and move the reports to the respective region folder with viewer access.

questions.question_text:
The Asia Pacific and Japanese sales teams from Cloud Kicks have requested separate report folders for each region. The VP of sales needs access to both report folders in one place to find reports for all of the regions, and wants to retain visibility of the reports in each folder.

What should the consultant recommend to meet the requirement?

choices.B: Create all new regional folders and move the reports to those folders with viewer access.
choices.A: Create all new regional folders and move the reports to those folders with subscribe access.
choices.C: Create grouped folders, keeping the top region folder sharing settings and limiting the sharing settings for the grouped folders.
choices.D: Create subfolders and give access to the root folder, keeping the top region folder sharing settings.

choices.C: Users can choose to show emails added via EAC in the Related Lists activities view.
choices.B: Users must connect an email account to Salesforce and agree to terms before they can send emails in Lightning.
choices.A: Users can share individual emails or make them private.
choices.D: Users can set their Excluded Addresses list which takes priority over the global Excluded Addresses list.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Emails aren’t shown in the Related Lists activities view: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sales.aac_guidelines.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: BC
B, C are rght

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters launched Salesforce for its EMEA subsidiary three months ago and wants to gain insight into usage and data quality.

Which two options should a consultant recommend to meet this requirement? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Create a custom report type using Account > Duplicate Record Set to identify potential duplicates.
choices.A: Download and analyze the Setup Audit Trail to determine number of new records per day.
choices.C: Create a custom report of active users by role and set up a weekly report subscription.
choices.B: Install the Salesforce Adoption Dashboard from the AppExchange.
